title._content: Photograph of postcard of rural carrier H.O. Carson in gig

description._content: Date: 1909 Object number: A.2009-50 Medium: postcard stock; photo-emulsion Description: Rural letter carrier H.O. Carson posed for a photographic postcard while working his mail route in a horse-drawn gig. Carson built a sling below his seat to hold the day's mail. There is no information on the card as to Carson's location. National Postal Museum, Curatorial Photographic Collection Photographer: Unknown Place: United States of America See more items in: National Postal Museum Collection Credit line: National Postal Museum, Curatorial Photographic Collection Photographer: Unknown Persistent URL:http://www.arago.si.edu/index.asp?con=2&cmd=1&id=207614 Repository:National Postal Museum View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.

note._content: You can see that this poor man is badly stressed and under pressure with his deliveries
note.author: 39191857@N05
